body.p:
War Department,
Provost Marshal General's Office,
Washington, D. C., January 23d 18634.
Gov. Thomas E. Bramlette
Sir:

I have the honor to apply to you for a Lieutenant's commission in some Kentucky Regiment now organising, or to be organised, for the defense of the State. I claim to be a citizen of Kentucky, having been connected with her press, as Editor of the Georgetown Journal, for some five or six years. I held a Lieutenant's commission in the State Guard from its organization to the time it was betrayed into the hands of Secessionists, when the company to which I was attached disbanded, and I resigned my commission.
I respectfully refer you to Ex-Gov. Robinson, Gen. John M. Harlan, Hon. D. C. Wickliffe and Dr. S. F. Gunn.

I am, Sir, very respectfully
Your Obedient Servant
Jno. Foster
